body:
This looks great, howevere remember that:
Any section can also have a "header" so this class name can be considered too general. Is this the only header of the site? Now and in the future? I would go with `navbar`.

Normally we have the nav inside a `header` tag, could you add one here?

body:
Probably the `Get Started` button sends me to a `registration` page.

However, there are cases where it opens something in a modal so it depends. 

So, since there is some ambiguity here, we can ask the owner of the design/application/product, etc to see what they actually want.

In this case, that person is me, and since I want the registration form to be on another page, let's make this a link.

P.D: Sorry if this sounded bad, I read it and it can be interpreted badly. The message that I want to transmit is that designs aren't always 100% clear and when you are confused about something you can reach to someone that has the answer.

body:
Try to keep a namespace here. A namespace is basically the start of the name here.
For example if you have `footer` as your `namespace`, you can change the rest of the classes to: `footer-upper` (Sounds a bit weird so I would go with `footer-top`), `footer-top-nav`, etc

body:
`input` without a label has a accessibility issue; when you have a design without a label, you can add the label to the field using the `aria-label` attribute: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/ARIA_Techniques/Using_the_aria-label_attribute

[More on accesibility](https://a11yproject.com/about/

body:
@julionav we thought the structure would be like:
1. Gravity
    1.1. Services
    1.2. Our works
    1.3. Testimonials
    1.4. We worked with
Because of that, we put the other bold texts in paragraphs, not headings (in this case, it was in an <h3> but right now Gustavo changed to a <p>). But maybe you could suggest us something better?

diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,129 @@ + + + + + + + + Contact + + +
+
+ + + +
+
+
+

Get in touch
body:
This is an interesting problem. 
Since the `starter-title1` was created originally for the get in touch section, here the class name doesn't make much sense and looks out of place ü§î 

In those cases, where you find yourself wanting to reuse a class, you can change its name to something more generic, like `big-title`

diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,129 @@ + + + + + + + + Contact + + +
+
+ + + +
+
+
+

Get in touch

+ +
body:
Here the name of the inputs don't need to have the `contact` prefix, it can have just the name of the property.
The name property will be the name this value is given when is received by a backend, later you will learn that it makes much more sense to have it as a `email` instead of `contact-email`, because by the time that you receive the data in the backed, you already know it comes from the `contact-form`.

It's a bit hard to explain here without the needed context so the advice is just to not use the prefix
